body_html:
Glad to hear you have a workaround for now.

A more appropriate fix would be to have the shape inference function for Conv2DBackpropInput work out the shape from gradients/attrs. For this, contributions are welcome.

Alternatively, if and when we move graph construction in Python to run on top of the C API, the ShapeRefiner might be able to provide the partial shape of the input and make this shape inference function more accurate (FYI @skye)
body_text:
Glad to hear you have a workaround for now.
A more appropriate fix would be to have the shape inference function for Conv2DBackpropInput work out the shape from gradients/attrs. For this, contributions are welcome.
Alternatively, if and when we move graph construction in Python to run on top of the C API, the ShapeRefiner might be able to provide the partial shape of the input and make this shape inference function more accurate (FYI @skye)
body:
Glad to hear you have a workaround for now.

A more appropriate fix would be to have the shape inference function for [`Conv2DBackpropInput`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/de7a060aa76cb3ab6cec16f9402d9152e341b0af/tensorflow/core/ops/nn_ops.cc#L566) work out the shape from gradients/attrs. For this, contributions are welcome.

Alternatively, if and when we move graph construction in Python to run on top of the C API, the ShapeRefiner might be able to provide the partial shape of the input and make this shape inference function more accurate (FYI @skye)
